Abortion Politics, History, Politics, Social Issues, State Capitol, Supreme Court
How We Got Here: Abortion in Wisconsin since 1849

	A documentary special from WPR News


								By								WPR Staff 
September 8, 2023 











Download




 






A challenge to Wisconsin’s abortion ban could already be making its way to the state Supreme Court. The law was first passed in 1849 and went back into effect last June when the U.S. Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade. In our half-hour special “How We Got Here: Abortion in Wisconsin since 1849,” Bridgit Bowden and Brady Carlson explore how the ban came to be and how Wisconsinites have lived with and without it since.

How Wisconsin’s 1800s-era abortion ban came to be


Wisconsin’s abortion law was on the books for over a century. But it rarely led to prosecutions.

How Wisconsin’s pre-Civil War abortion ban remained untouched during decades of political battle
